parameter.name: readConcern
parameter.description: The read concern option allows you to control the consistency and isolation properties of the data read from replica sets and replica set shards.

parameter.name: readPreference
parameter.description: Specifies the read preferences for this connection.

parameter.name: maximumStalenessSeconds
parameter.description: Specifies, in seconds, how stale a secondary can be before the client stops using it for read operations.

parameter.name: readPreferenceTags
parameter.description: If a replica set member or members are associated with tags, you can specify a tag set (array of tag specification documents) in the read preference to target those members.

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: writeConcernAcknowledgement
parameter.description: Requests acknowledgment that the write operation has propagated to the specified number of mongod instances. You can write a number of instances n>0 or use a value from the list.

parameter.name: writeConcernTimeout
parameter.description: This option specifies a time limit, in milliseconds, for the write concern. it is only applicable for Write Concern Acknowledgement values greater than 1

parameter.name: writeConcernTimeoutTimeunit
parameter.description: The Timeunit for the Write Concern Timeout.

parameter.name: serverAddresses
parameter.description: The server where your MongoDB instance is. You can set multiple servers.

parameter.name: database
parameter.description: Specify the database name that you want to connecto to.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The username to use for authentication.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to use for authentication. If the password is null or whitespaces only, the connector won't use authentication and username must be empty too.

parameter.name: replicaSetName
parameter.description: The name of the replica set to connect to. The server Addresses list can be partial when using this parameter. This means that the user can set just one host on Server Addresses, but set this value and It will connect to the full cluster

parameter.name: compressors
parameter.description: List of compressors to enable network compression for communication between this client and a mongod/mongos instance. If you specify multiple compressors, then the order in which you list the compressors matter as well as the communication initiator.

parameter.name: zlibCompressionLevel
parameter.description: An integer that specifies the compression level if using zlib for network compression. 0 means No Compression, 1-9 are the compression levels, with 1 being the lowest compression level, and 9 the most compressions (and more processing time)

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: The connection timeout; this is for establishing the socket connections (open). 0 is infinite.

parameter.name: connectionTimeoutTimeunit
parameter.description: The connection timeout unit.

parameter.name: localThreshold
parameter.description: The size of the latency window for selecting among multiple suitable MongoDB instances.

parameter.name: localThresholdTimeUnit
parameter.description: The local threshold Time Unit.

parameter.name: serverSelectionTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies how long to block for server selection before throwing an exception.

parameter.name: serverSelectionTimeoutTimeUnit
parameter.description: The server selection Time Unit.

parameter.name: socketTimeout
parameter.description: The socket timeout. It is used for I/O socket read and write operations. 0 is default and infinite.

parameter.name: socketTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: The socket timeout unit.

parameter.name: retryWrites
parameter.description: Enable retryable writes

parameter.name: authenticationMechanism
parameter.description: The authentication Mechanism used for this connection

parameter.name: minConnectionPoolSize
parameter.description: The minimum size for the connection pool.

parameter.name: maxConnectionPoolSize
parameter.description: The maximum size for the connection pool.

parameter.name: maxWaitQueueTime
parameter.description: The maximum wait queue time for the connection pool.

parameter.name: maxWaitQueueTimeUnit
parameter.description: The maximum wait queue time unit for the connection pool.

parameter.name: maxConnectionLifeTime
parameter.description: The maximum connection lifetime for the connection pool.

parameter.name: maxConnectionLifeTimeUnit
parameter.description: The maximum connection lifetime Time Unit for the connection pool.

parameter.name: maxConnectionIdleTime
parameter.description: The maximum connection idle time for the connection pool.

parameter.name: maxConnectionIdleTimeUnit
parameter.description: The maximum connection idle time Time Unit for the connection pool.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

extension.name: MongoDB
extension.description: MongoDB is an open source, high-performance, schema-free, document-oriented database that manages collections of BSON documents.

operation.name: addUser
operation.description: Adds a new user for this db

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: Name of the user

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password that will be used for authentication

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: collectionExists
operation.description: Answers if a collection exists given its name

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: the name of the collection

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: countDocuments
operation.description: Counts the number of documents that match the given query. If no query is passed, returns the number of elements in the collection

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: The target collection

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: The optional query for counting documents. Only documents matching it will be counted. If unspecified, all documents are counted. It can be: {"field1": "value1"} Or contain operators: { "field1": { $gte: 1, $lt: 10 } }

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createCollection
operation.description: Creates a new collection. If the collection already exists, a MongoException will be thrown.

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: the name of the collection to create

parameter.name: maxObjects
parameter.description: The maximum number of documents the new collection is able to contain

parameter.name: collectionSize
parameter.description: The maximum size of the new collection

parameter.name: collectionSizeDataUnit
parameter.description: Data Unit of the Collection Size parameter, by default it will be in Bytes

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createFile
operation.description: Creates a new file in the database, saving the given content, filename, contentType, and extraData.

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: The mandatory content of the new file. This content is an InputStream.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.description: The name of the new file.

parameter.name: metadata
parameter.description: A JSON object that hold any information you want to store.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createIndex
operation.description: Creates a new index

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: The name of the collection where the index will be created

parameter.name: fieldName
parameter.description: The name of the field which will be indexed

parameter.name: sortOrder
parameter.description: The indexing order

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: dropCollection
operation.description: Deletes a collection and all the objects it contains. If the collection does not exist, it throws a NOT_FOUND error.

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: The name of the collection to drop

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: dropDatabase
operation.description: Drop the current database

parameter.name: databaseName
parameter.description: The name of the database to drop.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: dropIndex
operation.description: Drops an existing index

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: The name of the collection

parameter.name: indexName
parameter.description: The name of the index to drop

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: dump
operation.description: Executes a dump of the database to the specified output directory. If no output directory is provided then the default /dump directory is used.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: Output directory where dump files will be created

parameter.name: outputNamePrefix
parameter.description: output file name prefix, if it's not specified the database name will be used.

parameter.name: oplog
parameter.description: point in time backup (requires an oplog)

parameter.name: operationTimeout
parameter.description: Maximum wait time for the dump

parameter.name: operationTimeoutUnit
parameter.description: Time unit for the maximum wait time for the dump

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: executeCommand
operation.description: Executes a command on the database.

parameter.name: command
parameter.description: The command to execute on the database as a Document.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: findDocuments
operation.description: Finds all documents that match a given query. If no query is specified, all documents of the collection are retrieved. If no fields object is specified, all fields are retrieved.

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: The optional query for finding documents. If unspecified, all documents are retrieved. It can be: {"field1": "value1"} Or contain operators: { "field1": { $gte: 1, $lt: 10 } }

parameter.name: sortBy
parameter.description: Indicates the document used to sort the results

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: Size of documents of each page to return

parameter.name: limit
parameter.description: Limit of documents to return.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: findFiles
operation.description: Lists all the files that match the given query

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: The query object used to list all the files. It can be: {"field1": "value1"} Or contains operators: { "field1": { $gte: 1, $lt: 10 } }

parameter.name: sort
parameter.description: Allows you to sort the result list. A file can only be sorted by files_id or uploadDate.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getFileContent
operation.description: Gets an InputStream to the content of the file specified by the fileID.

parameter.name: fileId
parameter.description: The mandatory File ID.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: insertDocument
operation.description: Insert a document in a collection. The _id object can be specified or not (and mongo will auto generate one).

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: The name of the collection where to insert the given document.

parameter.name: document
parameter.description: The document to insert

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: insertDocuments
operation.description: Insert a list of documents in a collection. The _id object can be specified or not (and mongo will auto generate one).

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: the name of the collection where to insert the given document.

parameter.name: documents
parameter.description: The list of the documents to insert.

parameter.name: writeOrdered
parameter.description: Indicates if the list of documents will be executed in order or not. Also If it's set in true and an error occurs during the processing of one of the write operations, MongoDB will return without processing any remaining write operations in the list.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: listCollections
operation.description: Lists names of collections available at this database

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: listIndexes
operation.description: List existent indexes in a collection

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: the name of the collection

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: mapReduce
operation.description:
Transforms a collection into a collection of aggregated groups, by applying a supplied element-mapping function to each element, that transforms each one into a key-value pair, grouping the resulting pairs by key, and finally reducing values in each group applying a suppling 'reduce' function.

Each supplied function is coded in JavaScript.

Note that the correct way of writing those functions may not be obvious; please consult MongoDB documentation for writing them.

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: the name of the collection to map and reduce

parameter.name: mappingFunction
parameter.description: a JavaScript encoded mapping function

parameter.name: reduceFunction
parameter.description: a JavaScript encoded reducing function

parameter.name: outputCollection
parameter.description: the name of the output collection to write the results, replacing previous collection if existed, mandatory when results may be larger than 16MB. If outputCollection is unspecified, the computation is performed in-memory and not persisted.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: removeDocuments
operation.description: Removes all the documents that match the a given optional query. If query is not specified, all documents are removed. However, please notice that this is normally less performant that dropping the collection and creating it and its indices again

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: The collection whose elements will be removed

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: The query object used to detect the elements to delete. It can be: {"field1": "value1"} Or contain operators: { "field1": { $gte: 1, $lt: 10 } }

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: removeFiles
operation.description: Removes the file that matches the given file id. If no file id is specified, all files are removed

parameter.name: fileId
parameter.description: The mandatory File ID to be deleted.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: restoreFromDirectory
operation.description: Takes the output from the dump and restores it. Indexes will be created on a restore. It only does inserts with the data to restore, if existing data is there, it will not be replaced.

parameter.name: inputPath
parameter.description: Input path of the dump files, it MUST be a directory.

parameter.name: dropCollections
parameter.description: whether to drop existing collections before restore

parameter.name: oplogReplay
parameter.description: replay oplog for point-in-time restore

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: restoreFromFile
operation.description: It does a restore from a single .bson file or zip file.

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: The name of the colletion to restore

parameter.name: input
parameter.description: An InputStream that points to the dump file. It can be a zip file or just a bson file

parameter.name: dropCollection
parameter.description: whether to drop existing collections before restore

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: updateDocuments
operation.description: Updates documents that matches the given query. If query is not specified, all documents are retrieved. If parameter multi is set to false, only the first document matching it will be updated. Otherwise, all the documents matching it will be updated.

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: the name of the collection to update

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: The query object used to detect the element to update. It can be: {"field1": "value1"} Or contain operators: { "field1": { $gte: 1, $lt: 10 } }

parameter.name: contentToUpdate
parameter.description: The object that will replace the one which matches the query.

parameter.name: multipleUpdate
parameter.description: If all or just the first document matching the query will be updated

parameter.name: upsert
parameter.description: If set to true, creates a new document when no document matches the query criteria. The default value is false, which does not insert a new document when no match is found.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: collectionName
parameter.description: The collection that will be watched to detect the matching documents.

parameter.name: watermarkField
parameter.description: The field that will queried to detect the objects that match the trigger condition.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: schedulingStrategy
parameter.description: Configures the scheduler that triggers the polling

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: The host you want to connect to.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port of the host that you want to connect to.
